p: Tinospora cordifolia ( T. cordifolia) has been commonly known as “Amrita” or “Guduchi”, belong to the Menispermaceae family. It has been one of the important drugs of Indian Systems of Medicine for a long time. Guduchi is native to India and mainly distributed in tropical areas such as Myanmar and Sri Lanka [ 98]. In India, this plant has been reported as the main source of treatments for many diseases such as fever, dyspepsia and urinary diseases in folk medicine [ 99].
